Description: Colorite Specialty Resins agreed to perform corrective measures at its Burlington, N.J., manufacturing facility to reduce harmful emissions of vinyl chloride to resolve alleged violations of federal and state environmental laws. Colorite agreed to pay a $1.3 million civil penalty to be split between the United States and the State of New Jersey and to perform two federal environment projects valued at over $1 million.
Agency: Justice Department Environment and Natural Resources Division
Info Source: https://www.justice.gov/archive/opa/pr/2008/August/08-enrd-732.html

Description: Colorite agreed to pay $650,000 to New Jersey and $650,000 to the federal government to resolve violations relating to vinyl chloride emissions. The settlement was also announced by the Justice Department; see the Violation Tracker entry at https://violationtracker.goodjobsfirst.org/violation-tracker/nj-colorite-specialty-resins
